entry.title: Re: Java heap space error in XI repository
entry.content: The “java heap space” error means that the system has run out of memory while handling your repository operations. As the error name says, this usually happens when the default memory allocated to the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is not sufficient or also when the objects being saved or processed are large. In order to resolve this, you can do a simple step, just give a try to increase the heap size in the JVM parameters of your application server so that it has more memory available to process repository objects. It’s really a good idea to review the repository content for very large mappings or objects that may be consuming excessive memory and optimize them if possible. Once the memory settings are adjusted, the issue should be resolved and saving objects in the repository should become smoother. You can check out this blog How to Solve OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space to understand more about this Java Heap Space error

entry.title: Como foi participar do SAP NOW AI TOUR BRAZIL 2025
entry.content:
Nos dias 19 e 20 de agosto aconteceu em São Paulo o SAP NOW Brasil 2025, reunindo mais de 3.000 participantes e mais de 300 sessões sobre inovação, tecnologia e transformação digital no ecossistema SAP.

O evento destacou como a inteligência artificial já está integrada ao SAP S/4HANA, SAP BTP e Business AI, trazendo casos reais de empresas que vêm alcançando resultados expressivos com soluções em nuvem.

O evento contou com empresas de Santa Catarina, como a Ramo Sistemas (Joinville, SC) e a MakeValue (Joinville, SC), parceira e patrocinadora que apresentou cases de conectividade bancária no SAP.

Foi uma oportunidade única de vivenciar a organização de um grande evento SAP e acompanhar de perto a interação entre clientes, parceiros e comunidade.

A edição de 2025 reforçou o quanto a comunidade SAP segue ativa, colaborativa e comprometida em cocriar o futuro dos negócios.

entry.title: Re: Declaration 390 - EC Sales List Romania
entry.content:
Hello @JAS3311 

Thanks for following up; everything is working as expected in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Here’s a breakdown of the process, with references for added clarity.

Here's an update on the EU Tip Code and what you should be aware of.

  • In the Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting app, you can easily add or remove tax codes and assign them to reporting groups. However, please note that you cannot directly edit the EU transaction code like “L”, “T”, “A”, “P”, “S” because that logic is built into the system. system.help.sap.com
  • The assignment of the EU code “tip” occurs automatically. It is based on the underlying properties of the tax code and the type of transaction. Therefore, you cannot override it by default.

Here's a quick look at what the Run Preview Override does. It's a handy feature that helps you see how things will look before finalising. This makes planning and adjustments much easier, giving you more confidence in your work.

  • If you see something like “A → L” during the Run Preview, that is purely a temporary, simulation-based override for that preview run. It doesn’t stick; it doesn’t change default system behaviour or persist in your system configuration.

Adjusting Default Settings: An Explanation of the Process

  • Since the EU code assignment is part of the system logic and isn't accessible for customer configuration in the public cloud edition, you cannot modify it directly.
  • To modify the default mapping, you need to either open an SAP Incident or submit a configuration or change request via SAP support. Self-service configuration for this mapping is not available option.

SAP documentation reference: SAP Help Portal – Declaration 390 (Romania)-section Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: How do I make DOX learn?
entry.content:
Hi 

I trying to load some purchase orders with different layouts. I Need to extract at least one field that is not included in the SAP standard schema (EAN no.), so I made a copy of the SAP_purchaseOrder_schema and added the ean header field to the copy.

The new field can have setup type Manual or Auto (with a default extractor). As I understand the documentation, a custom field must have setup type Manual. Also I understand that only setup type Auto will use the AI functionality and if I chose Manual setup type, I must make a template. Does this mean that fields with Auto are handled by the AI and fields with Manual are depending on the template?

So I have made the new field with setup type Manual and I have made a template.

Then I uploaded a file. Some data was extracted wrongly so I entered Edit mode and corrected the errors and saved the document again. Then I addet the document to the template.

Now I expected DOX to have learned from the corrections I made, but if I load exactly same document again, it still makes the same errors.

So, can anyone explain how DOX can learn and what setup influence the learning and what I can to to teach DOX?

Also I would like to understand, if I have 3 purchase orders with 3 very different layouts, can I handle this by adding the 3 documents to one template or must I create 3 templates or is it even better to create 3 different schemas?

I hope it is allright that I asked 3 questions in this thread as I think they are all related to the subject - how does DOX learn and fix extraction errors?

Kind Regards 
Thomas Madsen Nielsen

Has anyone worked in downloading excel with deep structure in RAP based fiori smart table?

entry.title: SAP MaxAttention IWS 'Accelerate your business transformation - Integrated Toolchain' (Sep 24, 2025)
entry.content:
Virtual

September 24, 2025

Agenda

Dear Valued Customer,

We are pleased to invite you to the SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop focusing on ‘Accelerate your business transformation with the Integrated Toolchain’ virtually taking place on September 24, 2025. Please find the current agenda here.

In today's rapidly evolving business landscape, organizations are constantly seeking innovative solutions to drive transformation and maintain competitive advantage. SAP Integrated Toolchain is a collection of SAP and partner tools designed to support all phases of a digital transformation journey. This workshop aims to showcase how the Toolchain, based on powerful solutions including SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, SAP Cloud ALM, Tricentis, and WalkMe, can streamline the transition from legacy systems to a cloud-based intelligent enterprise. Together, these tools provide a cohesive set of solutions for business process analysis, architecture planning, testing, and user enablement.

The integrated approach offered by SAP helps customers reduce transformation costs, accelerate time to value, and foster continuous innovation. Additionally, customers can leverage support from SAP MaxAttention to drive adoption of the Toolchain and ensure successful implementation. Attendees will gain comprehensive insights into leveraging this suite to optimize their business operations, enhance decision-making capabilities, and achieve sustainable growth. Through expert-led sessions, real-world case studies, and interactive demonstrations, participants will explore the full potential of SAP's Toolchain to navigate and succeed in their transformative business initiatives. Join us to discover how SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, SAP Cloud ALM, Tricentis, and WalkMe, combined with SAP MaxAttention support, can collectively pave the way for your organization's digital excellence.

The health and well-being of our customers, employees, and business partners is a top priority for SAP. We offer a virtual event format which allows you to have an interactive, digital experience, in a safe environment.

Our Workshops

These sessions and workshop series focus on a specific topic and the purpose is to enable our customers to understand the product portfolio and innovative technologies of SAP in order to drive adoption and consumption. As specifically now, it is more important than ever to help companies to be successful and to respond to changing markets by transforming into intelligent enterprises in the experience economy.

Important

Please note that the 'Attend' button which can be found within this blog post does not serve as a formal registration for the event.

To officially register, please reach out to me, paul.schropp@sap.com and I will ensure that your registration is properly processed.

We look forward to having you join us for our upcoming events and thank you for your understanding!

Your feedback

Feel free to share your feedback and thoughts in the comment section below.

entry.title: Re: Profit Center in Settlement Document | Settlement Man...
entry.content: @priya_sshekhar If the business volume and the split criteria are correct, then probably either something in the transfer manager or in a BADI is causing the issue. Please consider that settlement documents are also used by other applications than Condition Contract Management. I had once some strange behavior. After some long debugging session I found a BAPI implementation that caused the issue. This BAPI implementation was for Transportation Management. Lesson learned: If something is strange then review all BADI implementations.

entry.title: ODATA Services Cache control settings
entry.content:
Hello,

We have received request from third party system - middleware team for changes in cache control of OData service's specific entity sets. Below are comments from them- 

This header is restricting clients not to cache the response .

We don’t get the header while getting the metadata

We checked below configurable settings for ODATA but not sure how and where to maintain it.

Appreciate your help and guidance.

Regards,

Padmaja


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: ODATA Services Cache control settings
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

   You can use the documentation mentioned on the case https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/68bf513362174d54b58cddec28794093/05fb2651c294256ee10000000a445394.html

   I have found other ways to limit the cache control as well,

 

In Node.js, you can use middleware to modify the headers for specific OData entity set routes.

  1. Add Middleware to Handle Cache Control for Specific Routes:

    const express = require('express');
const odataServer = require('odata-server');
const app = express();

// Middleware to set cache-control headers for a specific entity set
const noCacheMiddleware = (req, res, next) => {
    if (req.path.startsWith('/MyEntitySet')) {
        res.set('Cache-Control', 'no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate');
        res.set('Pragma', 'no-cache');
        res.set('Expires', '0');
    }
    next();
};

// Use the middleware
app.use(noCacheMiddleware);

// Your OData configuration
const model = require('./model'); // Your OData model
const odata = odataServer(model);

app.use(odata);

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;
app.listen(PORT, () => {
    console.log(`Server is running on port ${PORT}`);
});

    If you have a controller that inherits from ODataController, you might want to override the ExecuteAsync method to add the Cache-Control headers.

    public class MyODataController : ODataController
{
    public override async Task<HttpResponseMessage> ExecuteAsync(HttpControllerContext controllerContext, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
    {
        HttpResponseMessage response = await base.ExecuteAsync(controllerContext, cancellationToken);

        response.Headers.CacheControl = new CacheControlHeaderValue
        {
            NoCache = true,
            NoStore = true,
            MustRevalidate = true
        };
        response.Headers.Pragma.ParseAdd("no-cache");
        response.Headers.Expires = DateTimeOffset.UtcNow.AddYears(-1);

        return response;
    }
}


    If this solutions solve this case you can close this post. If not we can continue discussing over here.

    Best Regards,
    Lucas

entry.title: Re: Company DB is not consistent; see log [Message 131-21...
entry.content:
Hi Joo_Leo

To investigate this issue: Please attach the 3 log files and the relevant information from Note 2380811

Mandatory Information required for SAP Business One Upgrade Incident .

If in your environment the upgrade still fails please attach the 3 log files from Note 2380811- Mandatory Information required for SAP Business One Upgrade Incident .
1. Setup.SetupWizard.xxxxxxxx_xxxxxx.pidxxxx.log.csv - SetupLogFile of the Wizard with results of the pre&post upgrade checks
2. Setup.b1logger.xxxxxxxx_xxxxxx.pidxxxx.log.csv - SetupLogFile of the whole upgrade process
3. Setup.B1Setup.xxxxxxxx_xxxxxx.pidxxxx.log.csv - SetupLogFile of the whole upgrade process

We suggest to create the support case using component SBO-BC-UPG with above logs to check this issue further.

Kind Regards
Nidhi
SAP Support

entry.title: Power BI using SAP BW Application Server
entry.content:
Hello,

I’m looking for some hands-on experiences and advice regarding connecting Power BI to SAP BW/4HANA using the SAP BW Application Server connector.

I have tested both Direct Query and Import options, but the performance is extremely poor:

  • Expanding the data model takes ~7 minutes

  • Selecting the query adds another ~8 minutes

  • Only after entering prompts, it takes an additional ~1 minute before I can even start building the report

This makes the development workflow almost unusable.

My questions are:

  1. Is this normal behaviour when using Power BI with SAP BW/4HANA via Application Server connectivity?

  2. Could this be related to configuration settings on the BW side or Power BI side? I’m testing a connection between Power BI Desktop and SAP BW/4HANA  which is on cloud. 

  3. Have you found better performance with Direct Query vs. Import?

I’d really appreciate any real-world experiences or best practices to understand whether this is a configuration issue on our side or simply a limitation of the connector.

Thanks in advance!

Cristina

entry.content:
Dear course participants, 

We hope you enjoyed the SAP Expert Lecture “Discovering High-Value Opportunities for Agentic AI” and found it valuable for your professional development. 

As of today, the course discussion forum is no longer actively moderated.  

Thank you to everyone who took the time to share questions, ideas and feedback during the course period — your engagement made the learning experience richer for all. 

If you’d still like to share feedback, the following options remain available:

  • For technical or general questions, use the Feedback function in the top left corner of the SAP Learning page. 

We look forward to seeing you in a future SAP Expert Lecture. 

Thank you for choosing SAP Learning!

Dagmar 
(SAP Learning)

entry.title: Do you know how to prepare for integrating SAP S/4HANA PEO?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Exploring SAP S/4HANA Manufacturing for Production Engineering and Operations (PEO)  learning journey.

 

Overview

This learning journey provides an in-depth functional overview of the SAP S/4HANA Manufacturing for Production Engineering and Operations (PEO) solution.

Learning objectives

  • Learners will be able to effectively set up the basic PEO processes, including creating MBOM and shop floor routing for efficient production processes and following standard procedures to ensure consistency and adherence to industry best practices.
  • Learners will demonstrate advanced proficiency in complex routing setup for unitized products, using parameter effectivity, qualifications, buyoff, and tool tracking capabilities to enrich production operations meeting industry standards.
  • Learners will possess the skills to optimize production operations and engineering changes in PEO. They will be equipped to implement process enhancements, manage major assembly projects, and drive operational efficiency within the organization.

Prerequisites

Essential: Basic knowledge of manufacturing life cycle
Recommended: SAP ERP (MM, PP, and QM modules)

Start learning

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

entry.title: Re: Automatic Attachment of documents in Purchase Orders...
entry.content:
Hi @Mayuri_Srivastava 

Your client’s requirement to automatically copy attachments from the Material Master to the Purchase Order is not delivered as standard functionality in S/4HANA. Here’s how you can approach it:

  1. Here is the Standard Behaviour
  • Attachments stored in the Material Master MM02/Display Material Fiori App are managed in Generic Object Services or Document Management System.
  • Please note that by default, these attachments are not automatically inherited into transactional documents such as Purchase Orders.

 

  1. Options for On-Premise / Private Cloud
  • Enhancement via BAdI / User Exit
    • Implement the BAdI ME_GUI_PO_CUST or ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST to program logic that:
      • Reads attachments from the Material Master via GOS or DMS API.
      • Copies them to the PO at the time of PO creation.
    • This requires ABAP development and knowledge of the attachment services.
  • Use DMS with Document Info Records
    • Store attachments in Document Info Records linked to the material.
    • Configure document assignment so that when a material is referenced in a PO, the linked DIRs are available.
    • This gives more control and traceability compared to GOS attachments.
  • Workflow or Output Management Integration
    • Instead of physically attaching the file in the PO, you can configure Output Management forms, email to fetch and display the related DIRs or attachments at runtime.
    • This way, the attachments follow the process without being duplicated into the PO.

 

  1. Public Cloud Limitation
  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, such an enhancement is not possible due to clean core principles.
  • Attachments can only be managed where SAP provides standard integration for example via DMS or Attachment Services but automatic inheritance into POs cannot be customized.

Here is my workaround recommendation: Use Document Management Service on SAP BTP and link documents at runtime instead of copying them.

Integration with SAP Document Management Service, Application Option

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Joule Introduction and its applications in SAP FICO
entry.content:
What Is SAP Joule?

SAP Joule is SAP’s AI copilot embedded across its cloud applications. It offers four interaction types—Transactional, Navigational, Informational, and Analytical—that let users perform business tasks via natural language within SAP environments. It understands user context, roles, permissions, and remains secure by design. It can also ground responses in your own business documents.

 How SAP Joule works in Public vs. Private Cloud is one of the most important considerations for finance teams (especially in FICO) deciding on adoption.

Here’s a structured view:

🔹 SAP Joule in Public vs. Private Cloud

  1. Deployment & Integration
  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
    • Joule is natively embedded and updated by SAP automatically.
    • Integration with SAP FICO apps (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, Controlling) is out of the box.
    • No additional installation required - users just activate and configure.
  • Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)
    • Joule can be enabled, but may require additional setup and integration.
    • Some Joule features might lag behind public cloud, because public gets innovations first.
    • Still integrates with FICO, but might require extra configuration & tenant connections to SAP BTP.
  1. Feature Availability
  • Public Cloud
    • Joule supports all 4 interaction types (Transactional, Navigational, Informational, Analytical) directly in Fiori apps.
    • Example in FICO: “Post vendor invoice” → transaction executes directly.
    • Faster delivery of Joule Agents and Joule Studio.
  • Private Cloud
    • Informational & Analytical features available early (queries, reports, insights).
    • Transactional flows may require enablement through custom skills/agents.
    • Joule Studio can still be connected via SAP BTP, but adoption speed depends on customer’s upgrade cycle.
  1. Customization & Extensibility
  • Public Cloud
    • Limited custom coding—extensions must go through SAP BTP side-by-side development.
    • Joule skills/agents are mostly standardized.
    • Great if you want speed & standardization.
  • Private Cloud
    • More flexibility: you can create custom FICO processes, reports, and Joule agents.
    • Easier to integrate with on-prem or legacy systems.
    • Suited for companies with complex finance processes.
  1. Data Security & Residency
  • Public Cloud
    • Data is hosted on SAP-managed hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP, SAP DCs).
    • Joule queries financial data via secure APIs; customers rely on SAP’s compliance.
  • Private Cloud
    • You control hosting, location, and more of the security stack.
    • Some finance-heavy industries (banking, defense, public sector) may prefer this for regulatory reasons.
  1. Upgrade & Innovation
  • Public Cloud
    • Quarterly upgrades → Joule features arrive first and fastest.
    • Example: New Joule Agents for FICO tasks (like dispute resolution) appear immediately.
  • Private Cloud
    • Annual upgrades (with optional Feature Packs).
    • Joule features arrive later—innovation follows public cloud by a few cycles.

📊 Comparison Table

Aspect

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Availability

Native, out-of-the-box

Needs setup, later adoption

Updates

Quarterly, fastest innovations

Annual/controlled upgrades

Customization

Limited, BTP-based

Flexible, deep customizations

Security

SAP-managed hyperscalers

Customer-controlled

FICO Use Cases

Immediate transactional & analytical support

Strong for complex, regulated finance scenarios

Joule Studio

Fully available

Available via BTP, more flexible

✅ Which is Better for FICO?

  • Public Cloud → Best if you want rapid innovation, standard finance processes, faster AI adoption.
  • Private Cloud → Best if you need deep customization, strict compliance, hybrid IT integration.

 SAP Joule version requirements for S/4HANA Cloud editions (Public and Private):

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Joule arrived as part of the Public Cloud starting around Q3 2024, and is embedded in all releases thereafter, including 2408 (August 2024) and onward.
  • While Joule is built into these releases, you still need proper entitlement and authorization to use it; this may require activation via your SAP admin or account executive.
  • There are setup guides available detailing how to activate Joule once entitlement is granted.

In Summary:

If your system is on Public Cloud release 2408 (Aug 2024) or later, Joule is already supported—assuming you've got the right access and permissions.

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Joule is available in the Private Cloud as well, but requires setup and configuration. It's not automatically active—you must enable it via SAP BTP and Joule Studio.
  • Technical prerequisites include ensuring the UI5 version in your system meets or exceeds the minimum required for Joule integration. The specific UI5 version will depend on your release; you can consult SAP documentation for exact details.

In Summary:

Private Cloud systems can support Joule—but you must set it up, ensure the UI5 stack is compatible, and configure the feature via BTP.

  1. SAP S/4HANA On-Premise (Classic)
  • Joule is not supported on on-premise S/4HANA. SAP has confirmed it's not on the current roadmap for classic on-premise systems.
  • There’s a planned strategy—possibly coming Q1 2025—to enable Joule via SAP Build Work Zone, BTP, and Joule Studio even for on-prem systems. But as of now, Joule remains unavailable on-prem and unsupported.

High-Level Overview

Edition

Supported from (release)

Requirements

Public Cloud

2408 (Aug 2024) onward

Needs entitlement/authorization & activation

Private Cloud

Post-2024 releases

Requires UI5 prerequisites + BTP/Joule Studio setup

On-Premise (classic)

Not supported (as of now)

No Joule availability; roadmap may include future BTP-based solution

Summary:

  • Public Cloud: Joule is supported starting with 2408 onward—activate it via entitlement.
  • Private Cloud: Joule is available but not automatic—requires UI compliance + setup via BTP.
  • On-Premise: Joule is not supported yet; no built-in version availability.

Here’s how SAP Joule, SAP’s generative AI assistant, can be applied specifically within the SAP FICO (Finance & Controlling) domain:

SAP Joule Application in FICO

  1. Transactional Interactions

Joule allows users to perform CRUD operations and manage financial documents via natural language—imagine asking:

  • “Post a vendor invoice of $5,000 to account X with due date Y.”
  • “Show me the status of PO invoice 10234.”
    While SAP hasn't yet released out-of-the-box FICO conversational flows, Joule’s transactional model supports this kind of interaction across cloud applications.
  1. Navigational Interactions

Instead of navigating through menus to reach Fiori apps like “Display GL Account Balances,” you could simply ask:

  • “Where can I review G/L balances?”
    Joule will direct you to the relevant screen.
  1. Informational Interactions

Straight answers instead of digging through help docs. You can ask:

  • “What’s the difference between cost center and profit center accounting?”
  • “Explain account determination for automatic postings.”
    Joule will deliver concise explanations, referencing SAP documentation or your own policy documents.
  1. Analytical Interactions

Joule bridges your natural-language queries to data analytics:

  • “Show me quarterly expense trends per cost center.”
  • “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
    It returns charts, metrics, or dashboards—leveraging SAP Analytics Cloud integration.

Advanced: Joule Agents & Studio

Joule Agents

SAP has introduced AI agents—autonomous actors capable of executing complex, multi-step workflows across business functions. In FICO, custom agents could:

  • Automate dispute resolution: Collaborate across finance and service teams to validate discrepancies and propose corrections.
  • Cash collection workflows: Analyze overdue invoices, coordinate with collections, and initiate follow-ups.
    These agents are part of SAP’s cross-functional automation strategy.

Joule Studio (within SAP Build)

No-code/low-code tool to create custom skills or agents tailored for your FICO needs:

  • Build a skill to automatically generate internal financial reports, or trigger approval workflows.
  • Automate vendor reconciliation or recurring postings by designing tailored AI agents.
    These skills and agents integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems.

Summary Table

Joule Capability

FICO Use Case Example

Transactional

Post invoices, check payment status via natural language

Navigational

Ask “Where to view Cost Center Reports?”

Informational

Clarify financial terms or posting rules

Analytical

Generate trends and KPI charts using SAC

Agents & Studio

Automate dispute resolution, cash collection, approvals

Key Benefits in FICO

  • Boost Productivity: Save time by speaking instead of clicking through screens.
  • Reduce Errors: Leverage conversational clarity and auto-generated documents.
  • Improve Insights: Conduct data reviews and root cause analysis through simple dialogue.
  • Automate Complex Workflows: Agents handle multi-step tasks such as reconciliations or approvals automatically.

Real-World Usage Context -- Caveats

While SAP is rapidly developing Joule’s capabilities, many implementations remain in pilot or PoC stages. Users in forums report limited early usage, primarily for basic navigation or queries.

 

Here are concrete FICO scenarios where you could pilot SAP Joule and even extend it with Joule Agents / Studio:

🔹 Pilot Scenarios in SAP FICO

  1. Invoice & Payment Handling
  • Ask Joule:
    “Post an invoice for vendor ABC with $12,000 due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Action: Creates the posting, validates tax code, and confirms with you.
  • Extension with Agent: Automate follow-up—if payment not cleared by due date, Joule Agent triggers a reminder email or escalates.
  1. Month-End Close Assistant
  • Ask Joule:
    “What are the pending tasks for month-end close?”
  • Joule Action: Lists open items (accruals, GR/IR clearing, reconciliations).
  • Extension with Agent: Automate recurring accrual postings and send alerts to approvers who are late in providing confirmations.
  1. Financial Analysis & Insights
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me expense trend per cost center for last 6 months.”
  • Joule Action: Returns a chart (via SAC integration).
  • Extension with Agent: Forecast next quarter’s expenses and flag cost centers that may exceed budgets.
  1. Audit & Compliance Checks
  • Ask Joule:
    “List journal entries above $50,000 in the last quarter without approvals.”
  • Joule Action: Generates a filtered list.
  • Extension with Agent: Create an automated internal audit agent that periodically checks for compliance exceptions and notifies controllers.
  1. Treasury & Cash Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “What is today’s cash position?”
  • Joule Action: Summarizes bank balances, incoming/outgoing payments.
  • Extension with Agent: Auto-generate a daily treasury dashboard at 9 AM and send to CFO.
  1. Dispute & Collections Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me customers with invoices overdue > 60 days.”
  • Joule Action: Lists overdue accounts.
  • Extension with Agent: An AI agent sends personalized payment reminders and schedules calls with collections staff.
  1. Budget vs. Actual Control
  • Ask Joule:
    “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
  • Joule Action: Shows variances with drill-down.
  • Extension with Agent: Automatically notify budget owners when variances exceed a threshold (say 10%).

🔹 How to Design in Joule Studio

In Joule Studio (within SAP Build) you can:

  1. Create a Skill → “Generate quarterly P&L by company code and send PDF to finance team.”
  2. Create an Agent → “Monitor overdue vendor payments and auto-initiate dunning.”
  3. Connect Non-SAP Apps → e.g., send approvals via MS Teams or Slack.

👉 This way, Joule moves from a copilot (answering queries) to a colleague (executing finance tasks for you).

 

Deep Dive on one of the real-world example: Vendor Invoice Posting with SAP Joule in Public vs Private Cloud.

🧾 Example: Vendor Invoice Posting with Joule

🔹 Scenario

A finance user wants to post a vendor invoice for Vendor 300012, amount $12,000, due in 30 days.

1️⃣ Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Understands the intent (“Create Vendor Invoice”).
    2. Pulls relevant master data (Vendor 300012 details, tax code, payment terms).
    3. Pre-fills the invoice screen in Fiori.
    4. User confirms → Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Public Cloud:
    • Joule can immediately display the document number and due date schedule.
    • If connected to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Joule can also show how this impacts cash outflow forecast.
    • Minimal setup → available out-of-the-box.

2️⃣ Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Joule recognizes intent, but instead of direct posting, it may:
      • Provide navigation → “Open FB60 (Vendor Invoice Entry)” or “Fiori App: Create Supplier Invoice.”
      • Pre-fill metadata only if integrated with custom Joule Skill via Joule Studio.
    2. User manually confirms or adjusts in the classic posting screen (e.g., FB60 / MIRO).
    3. Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Private Cloud:
    • You can customize Joule Agent (via Joule Studio + BTP) to enforce company-specific validations (e.g., block invoices >$10,000 without 2 approvals).
    • Joule can connect to legacy non-SAP apps (like OCR invoice scanners or in-house workflow systems).
    • Requires more setup & governance compared to Public Cloud.

📊 Side-by-Side Comparison

Step

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Activation

Native, plug-and-play

Needs setup & integration

Invoice Posting

Joule executes directly in Fiori app

Joule suggests navigation, may require custom agent for automation

Data Validation

Standard rules auto-applied

Flexible, can embed custom compliance rules

User Effort

Minimal (voice/text → posted)

Moderate (confirmation in screen, extra steps if no custom agent)

Analytics

Immediate cash flow impact via SAC

Possible, but may need manual SAC integration

Customization

Limited (SAP-standard process)

Flexible (custom workflows, approvals, legacy integration)

✅ Takeaway:

  • In Public Cloud, Joule = speed + simplicity → perfect for companies with standard finance processes.
  • In Private Cloud, Joule = control + flexibility → better if you need extra compliance steps, custom posting logic, or hybrid integration.

Joule SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Service SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Sales

entry.title: Re: PM order user status in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Some alternate workaround you can explore is use system statuses (e.g., CRTD, REL, TECO) to control process flow. Leverage Flexible Workflow for approvals and process control.Use custom fields or business rules to simulate status behavior. Consider event-based triggers or notifications via SAP Event Mesh or integration with external systems.

If user status control is critical for your PM process (e.g., blocking certain actions until inspection or approval), you may want to explore whether SAP Intelligent Asset Management or SAP Field Service Management offers more granular control for your use case. Or submit a request via the SAP Influence Portal for future enablement.

entry.title: Re: Error Handling and Reprocessing of Odata through Application Interface Framework (AIF) Tool
entry.content:
It can be used class/method /aif/cl_enabler_xml=>transfer_to_aif in order to store the paylod in AIF.

/aif/cl_enabler_xml=>transfer_to_aif(
EXPORTING
is_any_structure = aif_data
iv_cust_ns = 'DEMO' " Namespace of the Interface
iv_cust_type = 'DEMO001' " Interface name of the interface
iv_queue_ns = 'DEMO'  " Runtime Configuration Group 
iv_queue_name = 'XML'   " Runtime Configuration Group ID
* iv_save = 'X'
* iv_use_buffer = ''
* iv_create_run = 'X'
IMPORTING
ev_msgguid = data(msgguid)
* CHANGING
* cr_pers_queue =
).

btw: I would never use function modules any more in AIF apart from there is no class representation.
And in this case this class/method is saver to move the payload to AIF.

Otherweise you have to implement a little bit more than just this function module.

We have learned this the hard way.

entry.title: Re: changing the label count in the app Enter Time Ticket...
entry.content:
Hello @max_tillmann 

Thank you for your feedback and follow-up

  • There is no generic BAdI to modify OPD for a label field across processes..
  • In Public Cloud, you can only extend Output Parameter Determination (OPD) where SAP exposes a Select Expression as  a Custom Logic hook for that specific business object & step, such as Email Recipients, sometimes Form Template. If the OPD step doesn’t offer Custom Logic, you cannot influence it via BAdI. SAP Help Portal Output Parameter Determination  
  • SAP Support Portal 3384383 - Unable to implement custom logic for additional email recipients - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Your MES production completion label case

  • Production operation confirmation lacks a delivered output object/form interface in Public Cloud, so there’s no OPD or BAdI to adjust a label there. Use BTP/RAP and Forms service instead, as discussed earlier. SAP Community-In sap s/4 hana cloud, how to print production order confirmation?

Where a BAdI or Custom Logic can be applied example, below;

  • Email Recipients (Billing Documents): The OPD step supports custom logic via BAdI APOC_ADD_EMAIL_RECIPIENTS. Refer to help and KBA with sample implementations. Note: some apps/steps may not support this (error message documented in KBA). SAP Help Portal-How to Add Additional Email Recipients for Billing Documents by Using Custom Logic
  • SAP Support Portal-3331087 - Sample implementations of custom logic: Addition of Email Recipients - SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • EWM labels example HU / HU Shipping labels: these use Output Management; you configure and extend templates, and drive selection with OPD plant-/WH-specific. If your “label” is an EWM document, work within OPD and EWM lab the apps, not in production confirmation. SAP Community-How to enable the HU label and Shipping HU label in the Business context (HANDLINGUNIT)?

How to verify if BAdI is available for your document or step

  1. Open the Output Parameter Determination app → select the Application, such as Billing, Outbound Delivery, or EWM Warehouse Output.
  2. Open the Determination Step, like Email Recipients, Form Template.
  3. In Select Expression, look for Custom Logic. If it exists, implement it in Custom Fields and Logic (the app shows the released enhancement spot). If not, that step is not extensible. SAP Help Portal

KBA (activation error & scope). SAP Support Portal-3384383 - Unable to implement custom logic for additional email recipients - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Summary

  • If your label pertains to production operation confirmation, then no OPD/BAdI is required; instead, implement via BTP or RAP plus Forms service.
  • If it’s an output-enabled document Billing/Delivery/EWM HU, etc. and the OPD step offers Custom Logic, then implement the corresponding Cloud BAdI like APOC_ADD_EMAIL_RECIPIENTS) and drive your selection there.

Let me know if you need more support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Issue with Acct. Document status/clearance after cancellation of cancelled Billing Document
entry.content:
Hi, I'm dealing with a somewhat unusual situation where we're stuck with an accounting document (status "Not cleared") related to a cancelled Billing document. The cancellation document was canceled as well, both cancellations without Accounting document (not released to accounting) - this probably caused the issue. See the screenshot of document flow attached.

In short, that "Not cleared" accounting document is no longer needed, but we cannot cancel or reverse it - in SD, VF11 is not possible in this flow anymore, and in FB08 (FI) there is an error message: "Not possible to reverse the document in financial accounting."

Do you have any suggestions on how to cancel or reverse that unwanted, not cleared accounting document in this case?

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: Re: Rise issue with Personas flavor authorization
entry.content:
We found the issue, and it was indeed related to the Flavor. When we create or use a role for Personas, we need to copy it into /n/personas/admin and create a new one there. In several other Flavors, the role was correctly copied from the legacy system to Rise. However, in one specific Flavor, the role wasn’t copied — even though it appeared as a line in the Flavor Assignment, complete with description and details and all.

I’m not entirely sure what went wrong during the copy process for this particular role, but that was the root of the problem — and it’s now resolved.

entry.title: SAP custom analytical queries authorization
entry.content:
Hello Guys,

I am quite new to fiori. 

I've created a query in the custom analytical queries fiori application.
I've published the query and it is accessable from business user but when he launches the query it says the user does not have right for the analytical CDS view.

 

I do not have clue at the moment what kind of authorizations are missing I've checked SU53 on the user but to me these does not seems to be the real missing rights and on the CDS view there are no authorization check turned on in the annotation so I am wondering what could be the real problem.

 

 

Could you please help me out what authorization object needed in case you want to run Queries created in Fiori Custom Analytical query app as a business user ?

entry.title: Re: Sharing PO Responsibilities Between Two Company Codes...
entry.content:
Let us assume your Cross Company scenario is as under

  • Company Code 1 (CC1) issues the PO and pays the vendor.
  • Company Code 2 (CC2) receives the goods and handles customs/duties.
  • The inventory is held in CC2, but the invoice is processed in CC1.

Here the key assumption is a single purchasing organization is assigned to both CC1 and CC2. The plant in the PO belongs to CC2, but the company code in the PO header is CC1. GR is posted in CC2’s plant, but invoice verification (MIRO) is done in CC1.

With the above, the FI postings would be

Goods Receipt (GR) in CC2’s Plant - Even though the PO belongs to CC1, the plant is in CC2. When CC2 posts the GR, inventory is updated in CC2’s valuation area. So the Accounting entries would be

This creates a cross-company code posting, triggering intercompany clearing entries.

Next Automatic Intercompany Clearing - SAP automatically generates intercompany journal entries to balance the transaction between CC1 and CC2:

These entries ensure that CC1 owns the liability, but CC2 holds the inventory.

Next Invoice Verification (MIRO) in CC1 - When CC1 processes the vendor invoice:

This clears the GR/IR account in CC1 and settles the vendor liability.

Finally, Customs/Duties in CC2 - CC2 can post a separate service PO or manual invoice for customs/duties:

This keeps customs costs localized to CC2, as required.

The benefits would be

Inventory sits in CC2, where it's physically located.
Material cost is paid by CC1, maintaining financial responsibility.
Customs/duties are handled by CC2, aligning with operational reality.
Intercompany clearing accounts ensure proper legal and financial separation.

entry.title: फोनपे में गलत खाते में ट्रांसफर किए गए पैसे वापस कैसे पाएं?
entry.content: फोन पे से गलत अकाउंट में पैसे ट्रांसफर हो गए हैं, उन्हें वापस पाने के लिए क्या करे? फोनपे के कस्टमर केयर Number ((7759802798)) या पर कॉल करें. पे से गलत अकाउंट में पैसे ट्रांसफर हो गए हैं, उन्हें वापस पाने के लिए यानी अगर फोन पे से गलत पेमेंट हो गई है तो पहले फोनपे से शिकायत करें.

entry.title: Re: Fiori elements with TypeScript: Custom Action cannot...
entry.content:
I just faced the same problem and in my case it was related to the .controller in the file name of the generated controller extension: the event handler doesn't find a file without this postfix and therefore it fails. I didn't go into details but apparently this only happens if TypeScript is being used, with plain JS the error doesn't happen.

A quick fix or workaround: add the following to your Component.ts:

sap.ui.loader.config({
    map: {
        '*': {
            'namespace/ext/controller/ListReportExt': 'namespace/ext/controller/ListReportExt.controller',
            'namespace/ext/controller/ListReportExt.controller': 'namespace/ext/controller/ListReportExt.controller'
        }
    }
});

This way both paths resolve to the same file.

entry.title: Re: Issue Related to Inspection Points in SAP DMC
entry.content:
Hi @MOHAMEDAMINE_MOUNA30 

The error message you’re seeing in SAP Digital Manufacturing indicates that DMC cannot retrieve Usage Decision (UD) sets from your connected S/4HANA Cloud system due to missing authorizations or communication setup.

 

Here are a few reasons why this happens

  1. 403 Forbidden, this means Communication between DMC and S/4HANA Cloud is working but the user or technical user calling the OData service does not have authorization to read UD codes.
  2. The app Configure Inspection Points in DMC calls the S/4HANA Cloud service:
  3. If the Communication Arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud is missing the correct scope or the Communication User lacks business roles, DMC cannot fetch UD codes.

 

Here are Steps to enable you fix the issue

  1. Verify Communication Arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud
  • In S/4HANA Cloud, open the Communication Arrangements app.
  • Check the arrangement for SAP_COM_QUALITY_MANAGEMENT for example SAP_COM_0109 or the specific one used for DMC.
  • Ensure the service for Usage Decisions or Quality Management is active.

 See the following link Quality Management Communication Scenarios for more details.

  1. Check Communication User Authorizations
  • The Communication User linked to your arrangement must have business roles that allow:
    • SAP_BR_QUALITY_ENGINEER or SAP_BR_QUALITY_TECHNICIAN.
  • Without this, the designated user cannot fetch inspection-related data.
  1. Verify Usage Decision Codes in S/4HANA
  • You already mentioned UD codes are configured correctly in S/4. Ensure they are in Released status and available for the Plant you are testing.
  1. Retry in DMC
  • After fixing the communication arrangement and user roles, go back to DMC → Configure Inspection Points, choose your combination, and import UD set. The system should now fetch the codes without 403 error.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Technical Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: To be able send notifications to My Inbox App along with outlook
entry.content:
We are using flexible workflow for PR and PO. Currently, we have email notifications configured for notifying approvers that they have work items in their inbox, deadline notifications sent after 48 hours, approval of PR/PO sent to creator, rejection of PR/PO sent to creator. All these are configured with help of standard email templates available in Maintain Email Templates Application in Fiori.

However, we also have a requirement to be able to send the notifications to My Inbox of approvers or PO/PR creators. Is there a standard way of doing that?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: To be able send notifications to My Inbox App along w...
entry.content:
Hello,

The My Inbox app is meant to show only tasks and enable the execution of them through it. Therefore, it is not possible to have notifications shown there, even if they are related to the tasks.

What can possibly give a similar functionality to what you are seeking are the Fiori Push Notifications. Please refer to the below documentation:

  • SAP Note 2564178 - Push notification workflow: Composite SAP Note
  • SAP Help Page How to Setup Notifications in Fiori 2.0 step-by-step
  • KBA 2729492 - Configuring notifications in Fiori Launchpad and known restrictions 
  • KBA 2841951 - Fiori Launchpad Push Notifications for Task (TS) 
  • SAP Help Page Working with Notifications 
  • SAP Help Page Enabling Push Notifications 

Best regards.

entry.title: Re: Material Documents Overview app key features - S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Luana, 

I’d like to share two more points that could help improve clarity and efficiency for end users.

1. Transfer Postings Displayed in a Single Line

In the new version of the Material Document Overview app, stock transfers (e.g. between storage locations or material-to-material transfers) are shown as a single line item, which makes it difficult for users to understand the direction and nature of the transfer.

Suggested Enhancement:

  • Display transfer postings in two separate lines: one for the source and one for the destination.
  • Clearly label the "From" and "To" sides of the transfer to improve traceability and readability.

2. Combined Code and Description in Fields

Fields such as material, stock, movement type etc. display both the code and the description (e.g. material number + material description, stock number + stock description, movement type + movement description). This results in long field values that take up excessive screen space.

Suggested Enhancement:

  • Allow users to customize the display format: choose between showing only code, only description, or both.
  • Introduce a compact view mode to reduce visual clutter and make room for other important data (e.g. quantity, batch, serial number).

I would really appreciate it if someone could take a look at this. Even small improvements like these can make a big difference for end users. We really appreciate the great work SAP is doing and we just want to help make things even better.

BR, Monika

entry.title: Re: How to create an ATP TS Strategy for Synchronized Pla...
entry.content:
Hi @Olli76 

There is currently no standard way to create or assign a TS ATP Strategy in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, as this functionality is not available out-of-the-box for public cloud editions. Most advanced ATP features such as strategy assignment with PP/DS heuristics for synchronized planning are found in the private edition or require additional licensing on-premise.

Synchronized Planning (PP/DS + aATP)

  • aATP handles the availability check and confirmations.
  • PP/DS heuristics (like SAP_PP_019 for supply creation or finite scheduling) are executed to generate supply proposals.
  • The system synchronizes confirmations with planning results, but without a manual TS ATP Strategy assignment.

Available configuration in Public Cloud

  • Instead of customizing ATP strategies, I suggest you configure:
    • ATP Rules via Configure Advanced ATP app, SSCUI 104067.
    • Product Allocation & Supply Protection as business rules.
    • Synchronized Planning Settings in Manage Planning Procedure app.

Workaround / Best Practice

  • Model your required ATP behaviour for example whether to confirm from stock only, include planned orders or allow future receipts via the available aATP rule configuration.
  • If you want the PP/DS heuristic to create supply on demand like the classic TS ATP strategy would trigger, I suggest you use:
    • Heuristic SAP_PP_019 which is the Stock Requirements List Heuristic or Product Heuristic SAP_PP_002 combined with pegging.

Production Planning Integration Based on Orders (RTI)

3193069 - Advanced ATP on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: all Knowledge Resources and Central How-to KBA

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris
